title.narrative: Puerto Rico Hot Meal Hurricane Response

description.narrative: As Puerto Rico was recovering and responding to the destruction in the wake of Hurricane Irma, Hurricane Maria hit the island on 20th September 2017. Coming so quickly on the heels of Irma, Maria had a multiplying effect on the damage done, and as it hit the island full-on it had much more destructive impact. The electrical infrastructure on the entire island was knocked out and has remained so until the writing of this proposal. This has also impacted the island’s potable water system, the pumps for which are run by electricity. Maria also destroyed much of the island’s agriculture. Stores are closed, and those that are open are experiencing severe shortages in food and water. Without electricity the monetary system on the island is forced to depend on cash, of which there is also a shortage (banks are only allowing withdrawals of $500/day, for individuals as well as for institutional accounts). Needs assessments have been conducted by ADRA representatives in each of the 4 Seventh-day Adventist Conferences (aligned with ADRA’s 4 fields of work), and the priority needs are water and food.
